channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 在笔记本电脑前工作了一天，脖子酸痛吗？像 PowerDot 2.0 这样的 TENS 电疗仪可以利用电子肌肉刺激来缓解疼痛和酸痛。
item.description:
Neck aching after a day at your laptop? A TENS unit like the PowerDot 2.0 employs electronic muscle stimulation to relieve pain and soreness. https://t.co/Fbr2j9KqxA https://t.co/Fbr2j9KqxA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 超级通勤者需要大量的金钱、里程数和耐力。以下是《华尔街日报》的一位记者如何从俄亥俄州的家中前往纽约工作。
item.description:
Being a supercommuter takes a lot of money, miles and stamina. Here's how a WSJ reporter has been traveling to work in New York City from his home in Ohio. https://t.co/oidFsab7uN https://t.co/oidFsab7uN

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 在了解了最新的旅游趋势、著名的旅游景点和令人流连忘返的行程之后，我们为您的下一个假期提供了一些建议
item.description:

item.title: 今年的大学招生季 "一团糟"。联邦助学金申请、考试要求和平权法案的变化带来了混乱。
item.description:
College admissions season is “a hot mess” this year. Changes to the federal financial-aid application, testing requirements and affirmative action have sown chaos. https://t.co/d8SEx3v359 https://t.co/d8SEx3v359

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 13, 2024

item.title: 如果你想活到 100 岁，健康的生活习惯只能帮你到这一步。以下是科学家们现在对活到 100 岁的了解。
item.description:
If you want to live to your 100th birthday, healthy habits can only get you so far. Here’s what scientists now know about living to 100. https://t.co/H7oBDlox7Y pic.twitter.com/ixhkCGJeUm

item.title: 美国总统拜登在最新一轮初选投票中赢得了足够的代表席位，成为该党的推定提名人，预计前总统唐纳德-特朗普将很快达到这一门槛
item.description:
President Biden won enough delegates to become the presumptive nominee of his party in the latest round of primary voting, with former President Donald Trump expected to soon hit the threshold https://t.co/yps2S1sAVJ https://t.co/yps2S1sAVJ

item.title: "私募股权》是一本关于在残酷、高风险的顶级对冲基金世界工作的新回忆录。点击此处阅读节选。

item.title: "风往哪儿吹，我们就往哪儿去"。没有债务，坐拥巨额存款，DINKs--"双职工，无子女 "夫妇--正在夸耀频繁旅行、财务自由和慷慨赠与的美德。
item.description:
"We go where the wind blows." Free of debt and sitting on hefty savings, DINKs—"dual income, no kids" couples—are boasting the virtues of frequent travel, financial freedom and generous gifting. https://t.co/H4BCBAjZFw https://t.co/H4BCBAjZFw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 欧洲当局挫败了几起涉嫌恐怖袭击的阴谋，其中一些涉及冒充难民的嫌疑人，这引起了人们对极端分子日益增长的威胁的警惕
item.description:
Authorities in Europe have foiled several alleged terror plots, some involving suspects posing as refugees, raising alarm about a growing array of threats from extremists https://t.co/AqteuF1PUd https://t.co/AqteuF1PUd

item.title: 这张照片本应向世人保证，威尔士王妃凯瑟琳一切安好。结果适得其反。
item.description:
It was the photo that was supposed to reassure the world that all was well with Catherine, Princess of Wales. It backfired. https://t.co/f0Sa5dneBv https://t.co/f0Sa5dneBv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: "你知道《驱魔人》里 那个女孩从床上飞起来撞到天花板的场景吗？就是那个场景"乘客们描述了拉塔姆航空公司航班上发生的事情，飞机在半空中突然坠落。
item.description:
“You know in The Exorcist, when the girl flies from the bed and hits the ceiling? It’s exactly that scene.” Passengers describe what happened on board the Latam flight that suddenly dropped midair. https://t.co/BSHE6AbHYv https://t.co/BSHE6AbHYv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 两周前，TikTok 的美国高管飞往该公司位于新加坡的国际总部，告诉他们的上司该应用没有被禁的危险。回到美国后，他们才知道自己算错了。
item.description:
Two weeks ago, TikTok executives from the U.S. flew to the company’s international headquarters in Singapore and told their bosses the app wasn’t in danger of getting banned. After returning to the U.S., they learned they had miscalculated. https://t.co/71IvGF87eM

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登政府及其盟友对罗伯特-赫尔大加指责。但 "拜登失去了他的快球 "这一观点并不是他创造的。美国人民自己得出了这个结论，@wjmcgurn 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The Biden administration and its allies have come down hard on Robert Hur. But he didn’t create the idea that Biden has lost his fastball. The American people reached that conclusion themselves, writes @wjmcgurn. https://t.co/rz8hRwMUbH https://t.co/rz8hRwMUbH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 拜登政府表示，它将向基辅增发 3 亿美元的弹药和其他武器，作为加强乌克兰军队的权宜之计。
item.description:
The Biden administration said it is sending $300 million more in ammunition and other weapons to Kyiv in a stopgap move to boost Ukraine’s forces https://t.co/pliUxBxZtW https://t.co/pliUxBxZtW

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 黎巴嫩真主党民兵向以色列北部发动了自加沙战争开始以来最猛烈的炮击，尽管美国努力制止跨境炮火
item.description:
Lebanon’s Hezbollah militia launched its heaviest barrage on northern Israel since the war in Gaza began, despite U.S. efforts to halt the cross-border fire https://t.co/SjcvdRBqes https://t.co/SjcvdRBqes

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@gerardtbaker写道：值得反思的是，为什么在众多国家中，以色列为生存而战的权利却受到广泛争议？
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: It’s worth reflecting on why, singularly among nations, Israel’s right to fight for its survival is widely disputed, writes @gerardtbaker https://t.co/V5DO01WtH4 https://t.co/V5DO01WtH4

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：禁止 TikTok 应该是最后的手段，但 ByteDance 和中国政府已经证明他们不可信。有证据表明，中国政府可以利用该应用在美国进行网络间谍和政治影响活动。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Banning TikTok should be a last resort, but ByteDance and Beijing have demonstrated that they can’t be trusted. Evidence shows how the Chinese government can use the app for cyber-espionage and political influence campaigns in the U.S. https://t.co/dh5D5WO5AK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登需要在国情咨文中解释为什么世界局势在他的眼皮底下变得如此糟糕，以及他打算如何阻止这种下滑，而不是再次向选民讲述特朗普的缺点。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Rather than telling voters, again, about Trump’s shortcomings, Biden needed to explain in his State of the Union why the world situation has grown so dramatically worse on his watch and how he intends to stop the slide, writes @wrmead https://t.co/aeVSAqekuu

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：我们应该仔细考虑欧洲更加自治的后果。@AaronBMacLean 写道：让这些国家自力更生可能只是它们的手伸向彼此喉咙的前奏。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: We should give careful thought to the consequences of a more autonomous Europe. Putting these countries on their own feet may merely be the prelude to their hands reaching for one another’s throats, writes @AaronBMacLean. https://t.co/iBq0Szzi9G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 苹果公司表示，它将允许欧洲的 iPhone 用户直接从开发者的网站上下载应用程序，这标志着该公司在面对欧盟新的竞争规则时向监管机构作出的又一次让步。
item.description:
Apple says it will allow iPhone users in Europe to download apps directly from a developer’s website, marking another concession to regulators as the company faces new competition rules in the European Union https://t.co/OIqCfmhqKB https://t.co/OIqCfmhqKB

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 在一项对驾驶辅助系统进行评估的研究中，特斯拉和福特汽车等几家汽车制造商的成绩不佳
item.description:
Tesla and Ford Motor were among several automakers to receive poor grades in a study that reviewed driver-assistance systems https://t.co/2vxxtFNwkr https://t.co/2vxxtFNwkr

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 25 岁的托尼-伦纳德（Tony Leonard）跟随母亲进入牙科卫生行业，在世界因科维德-19 停产后完成了他的学士学位。尽管如此，他还是立即找到了工作。他说，牙科卫生的工作很有保障，因为需求很旺盛。
item.description:
Tony Leonard, 25, followed his mother into dental hygiene, finishing his bachelor’s degree right after the world shut down from Covid-19. Still, he found work immediately.

He says dental hygiene offers job security because demand is strong. https://t.co/puNgRmRmqo pic.twitter.com/kX8enQVl37

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 美国数以百计的工作岗位是根据性别和种族来划分的？查看数据，了解美国许多最重要的职业是如何对工人进行分类的。
item.description:
Who fills hundreds of U.S. jobs according to their gender and race? See data that offers a snapshot of how workers sort themselves into many of the most important professions in the country https://t.co/mqxpR3EmPe

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 33 岁的卡西-约克（Casi York）在年轻时当过课外教师，后来成为一家幼儿教育机构的助教。我们是专业教师"。
item.description:
Casi York, 33, became a teacher’s assistant at an early childhood education program after working as an after-school teacher as a young adult.

“We’re not babysitters. We're professional teachers.” https://t.co/sS7z7nXxns pic.twitter.com/4p9ikcVmPB

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 33 岁的肖娜-欧文（Shauna Irving）作为一名电工学徒，有时不得不拼命学习。男人们会插手帮她做一些事情，往往是想帮她的忙。"你必须有主见，因为你的经济保障取决于你对自己行业的了解程度"。
item.description:
Shauna Irving, 33, sometimes had to fight to learn as an apprentice electrician. Men would step in to do something for her, often trying to be helpful.

“You have to be assertive, because your economic security depends on how well you know your trade.” https://t.co/lYAzw0tIj9 pic.twitter.com/FK8JUiLNSk

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 22 岁的马代-克鲁兹（Madai Cruz）在一次实习后将自己的专业从农场管理转到了伐木业，因为她整天都要在树林里操作重型设备。"班组里的每个人都把我当成自己的臂膀。如果我想学什么，他们都会帮助我。
item.description:
Madai Cruz, 22, switched her major from farm management to logging after an internship had her spending her days in the woods and running heavy equipment.

“Everyone on my crew has taken me under their arm. If I want to learn something, they'll help me.” https://t.co/7vH5NEOxYE pic.twitter.com/42T5JpnFgz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024

item.title: 从伐木到牙科卫生，美国的许多职业几乎都是由女性或男性来完成的。我们采访了四位选择了性别离群工作的人，听听他们一路走来的收获和挑战。
item.description:
From logging to dental hygiene, many occupations in the U.S. are done almost entirely by women or men.

We spoke to four people who chose jobs where they are gender outliers—and heard about the rewards and challenges along the way. https://t.co/bsHgWKCm4H https://t.co/AzmbDXz9wk

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 12, 2024
